titleStmt.title: The husband's authority unvail'd; wherein it is moderately discussed whether it be fit or lawfull for a good man, to beat his bad wife. Some mysteries of iniquity are likewise unmasked, and a little unfolded. A subject, to some, perhaps, as unwelcom as uncoth. / From an inner cloyster of the Temple; by Moses à Vauts a faithfull votary, and free denizen of the Common-wealth of Israel.
titleStmt.author: Vauts, Moses à.

titleStmt.title: The husband's authority unvail'd; wherein it is moderately discussed whether it be fit or lawfull for a good man, to beat his bad wife. Some mysteries of iniquity are likewise unmasked, and a little unfolded. A subject, to some, perhaps, as unwelcom as uncoth. / From an inner cloyster of the Temple; by Moses à Vauts a faithfull votary, and free denizen of the Common-wealth of Israel.
titleStmt.author: Vauts, Moses à.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T.N. for Robert Bostock at the sign of Kings-head in Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: The last leaf bears the postscript and errata.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Moses à Vauts is possibly a pseudonym.
